Subjective: Tired for 2 months. Fatigue all day, sleeps a lot but wakes up tired. No clear cause. No acute onset. Can still do sports, work, but feels unenthusiastic. Muscle pain, back pain more than usual. No respiratory problems, no allergies, no unusual palpitations, no chest pain. Normal appetite, weight stable, daily bowel movements, smooth stool, normal urination.
Objective: BP 110/60. HR 60. Lungs sound fine. Back examination: no specific pain when pressing vertebrae, but a bit of pain next to the center. Pelvis examination: no pain when pressing from the side. Abdomen examination: lively peristalsis, no pain when palpating.
Assessment: Likely fatigue syndrome, possibly related to anemia, thyroid issues, or inflammation. Rheumatoid arthritis unlikely.
Plan: Schedule phone appointment to discuss results
